title: CampWiz NXT

home.welcome: A short welcome phrase like Welcome {{name}}. In this case, {{name}} is a placeholder for the user's name. If the user is not logged in, it will be empty.
home.subtitle: The translation of our slogan "Taking jury experience to another level"
home.publicRunningCampaigns: Anyone can participate in those campaigns which are public. This label would be shown in the home page
home.yourCampaigns: The campaigns that are asigned to you. Technically, you are either a jury, or co-ordinator of those campaigns. This label would be shown in the home page
home.dashboard: The dashboard where only admin or project leads can go to manage campaigns, This would be placed on a button so try to keep it short and one word
home.doc: The button for the link of documentation page

settings.title: Settings
settings.helpTranslation: A request for users to help translate the application to their language. This label would be shown in the home page. The <0>TranslateWiki is a link to the TranslateWiki website where users can contribute translations. Please keep <0>TranslateWiki as it is.

login.title: A proposal to Login
login.afterLoginRedirect: After this process, you will be redirected back to the following page:

status.PAUSED: Status indicating that the campaign or the round is not currrently running, but can be resumed
status.COMPLETED: Status indicating that the campaign or the round is completed and no further actions are needed
status.ARCHIVED: Status indicating that the campaign or the round has been archived or sealed and no other actions can be taken
status.IMPORTING: Status indicating that submissions (image/audio/video) are being imported into the campaign. This status is used when the campaign is created and the submissions are being imported from various sources like Wikimedia Commons, or other sources. This status is used to indicate that the campaign is not yet ready for evaluation and the submissions are being imported.
status.DISTRIBUTING: Status indicating that the submissions are being distributed to the juries for evaluation. This status is used when the campaign is created and the submissions are being distributed to the juries for evaluation. This status is used to indicate that the campaign is not yet ready for evaluation and the submissions are being distributed.

round.submissions: The image, video, audio or any other type of file that is submitted by the participants of the campaign. This label would be shown in the home page
round.assignments: Each jury would be assigned a number of submissions to evaluate. This label would be shown in the home page
round.evaluatedOutOf: {{evaluated}} evaluated out of {{total}}. Here {{evaluated}} and {{total}} are placeholders for the number of evaluated submissions and the total number of submissions respectively. This label would be shown in the home page.
round.evaluationArea: A Button to go the page where the juries can evaluate the submissions. This label would be shown in the round page
round.categorizer: A Button to go the page where the juries can categorize the submissions. This label would be shown in the round page

footer.campwizNxtTeam: Name of our Team who is behind this tool
footer.manual: The page where the user can find instructions on how to use the application. This label would be shown in the home page
footer.terms:
The text that links to the terms of service. Should not be capitalized.
{{Identical|Term}}
footer.reportBug: A label for the link to the bug report page. This label would be shown in the home page

error.noAssignedCampaigns: The error message that would be shown when the user has campaigns found in which the person is assigned as a jury or co-ordinator. This label would be shown in the home page
error.loadingSubmissionDetails: Could not load submission details: {{error}}. Here {{error}} is a placeholder for the error message. This error would be shown when submission details could not be fetched from the backend. This label would be shown in the submission details page
error.categoriesNotLoaded:
Categories are not loaded yet.
This error would be shown when the categories are not loaded yet in the categorization page. This label would be shown in the categorization page
error.campaignNotFound: Campaign not found. This error would be shown when the campaign is not found in the backend. This label would be shown in the campaign page
error.campaignCategoriesNotSupported: Campaign categories are not supported. This error would be shown when the campaign does not support categories. This label would be shown in the campaign page
error.noSubmissionAvailableForCategorization: No submission available for categorization. This error would be shown when there are no submissions available for categorization. This label would be shown in the categorization page
error.noCategoriesSelected: No categories selected. This error would be shown when the user tries to save the submission without selecting any categories. This label would be shown in the categorization page
error.noCategoriesAvailable: No categories available. This error would be shown when there are no categories available for selection. This label would be shown in the categorization page
error.noSubmissions: No submissions available. This error would be shown when there are no submissions available for evaluation or categorization. This label would be shown in the evaluation page

close: Label for a generic close button. For example, the user can click on the close to close a modal or a dialog box
previous: Label for a generic previous button. For example, the user can click on the previous to go back to the previous page
next: Label for a generic next button. For example, the user can click on the next to go to the next page
return: Label for a button that allows the user to return to the previous page. For example, the user can click on the return to go back to the previous page. This button might also take users to the home page if they are not in a specific page. Please keep it short and one word.

modifytable.name: Label for the name of the submission.
modifytable.score: Label for the score of the submission.
modifytable.preview: Label for a button in the modify table that allows the user to preview the submission. For example, the user can click on the preview to see the submission
modifytable.action: Label for list of Action the user can take on this assignment. For example, the user can click on the preview to see the submission, or click on the edit to change the score of the submission

evaluation.skip: Label for a button that allows the user to skip the submission. For example, the user can click on the skip to skip the submission and go to the next submission
evaluation.edit: Label for a button that allows the user to modify vote or score of the submission. For example, the user can click on the edit to change the score of the submission
evaluation.yes: Label for a button that allows the user to accept the submission. For example, the user can click on the yes to accept the submission
evaluation.no: Label for a button that allows the user to reject the submission. For example, the user can click on the no to reject the submission

languages.en: English (English). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is English, it should be "<Translation of the name English in your language> (English)"
languages.bn: Bengali (বাংলা). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is Bengali, it should be "<Translation of the name Bengali in your language> (বাংলা)"
